Upgrading or Changing Rental Copiers: What You Need to Know

July 8, 2025 Marga Enterprises


Focus Keyword: Upgrading or Changing Rental Copiers
Word Count: ~1,700 words

Renting a copier has become a practical choice for many businesses, especially in today’s fast-paced and technology-driven environment. But what happens when your current machine no longer meets your needs? Whether your office has grown, your workload has shifted, or you simply want better features, upgrading or changing rental copiers might be the best decision for your business.

In this blog post, we’ll walk you through when and why to consider an upgrade, what to expect during the process, how to avoid hidden costs or service interruptions, and how to make an eco-conscious decision in the process. By the end, you'll be equipped to make a smooth and beneficial transition.

Why Businesses Consider Upgrading or Changing Rental Copiers

1. Increased Workload

Your business might have started with a modest volume of print and copy needs, but if you’ve grown over the months or years, your current machine may not be keeping up. Frequent breakdowns, slow printing speeds, or paper jams are common signs it's time to upgrade.

2. Outdated Technology

Copier technology is constantly evolving. Modern devices offer cloud connectivity, wireless printing, enhanced data security, and energy efficiency. If your current unit doesn’t support these features, you could be missing out on time and cost savings.

3. High Maintenance Frequency

Do you find yourself calling for technical support more often than you used to? A copier that constantly needs repair can drain your productivity—and your budget. Switching to a newer, more reliable model could reduce service calls and downtime.

4. Environmental Goals

Sustainability is no longer just a buzzword—it’s a business responsibility. Older copiers consume more electricity and toner and may not support duplex (double-sided) printing. Newer models are designed to reduce waste and carbon footprint.

Learn more about the environmental impact of copier rentals and how upgrading can support your green initiatives.

Signs It's Time to Upgrade or Change

Not sure whether it’s time to make a move? Here are a few red flags:

  • Slower processing time compared to office needs

  • Increased employee frustration with copier errors

  • Frequent toner/paper shortages due to low capacity

  • Security vulnerabilities or lack of software updates

  • Incompatibility with new devices or systems in your office

Benefits of Upgrading or Changing Rental Copiers

Let’s explore the key advantages of moving to a better-suited copier:

✔ Better Performance

Newer copiers deliver faster speeds, higher resolution, and seamless connectivity—perfect for busy environments.

✔ Enhanced Security

Modern machines often come with built-in security features like user authentication, encrypted hard drives, and secure print release to protect sensitive documents.

✔ More Features

You can take advantage of functionalities such as mobile printing, automatic document feeders, or built-in finishing options like stapling and hole punching.

✔ Lower Energy and Consumable Costs

Newer machines often meet ENERGY STAR® standards and use toner more efficiently, helping you save money over time.

✔ Greater Flexibility

You may need a different type of copier for new business requirements, such as event-based operations. Copier rentals for events and short-term needs are often upgraded to provide compact, easy-to-set-up models.

How to Upgrade or Change Your Rental Copier

Here’s a step-by-step guide to help you through the process:

Step 1: Review Your Current Contract

Before initiating an upgrade, check your rental agreement. Are you locked into a specific term? Are there upgrade clauses or penalties for early termination?

If you're unsure how to navigate contract issues, you might find this article helpful: Handling Copier Rental Disputes

Step 2: Assess Your Current and Future Needs

Make a checklist of what your team needs in a copier:

  • Daily/monthly page volume?

  • Color or black-and-white?

  • Scanning, faxing, or finishing needs?

  • Cloud or remote printing capability?

This assessment ensures that your upgrade fits not only your current but also future workflow.

Step 3: Consult Your Rental Provider

Most rental companies offer flexible options for upgrades, especially if you’ve been a long-time client. Ask:

  • Are there any trade-in deals?

  • Can I switch models within the same contract?

  • What are the delivery and installation timelines?

If your rental provider offers international services, this is also a good time to align copier needs across branches. Learn more at International Copier Rentals

Step 4: Schedule Delivery and Installation

Once you select a new unit, coordinate delivery and installation to avoid disruption. Make sure your IT team is involved if you need to integrate with existing networks or cloud services.

Step 5: Return the Old Unit Properly

Ensure that the old copier is returned in accordance with your agreement. Document the return condition to avoid unnecessary fees.

Common Mistakes to Avoid

  • Ignoring the Contract Fine Print: Early upgrades may come with fees unless previously arranged.

  • Not Consulting Staff: Users know the daily pain points. Get their input on copier features that truly matter.

  • Underestimating Future Growth: Choose a model that can handle more than your current demand.

  • Skipping a Site Survey: Some machines may be too large for your space or require special electrical connections.

Frequently Asked Questions

Can I upgrade mid-contract?

This depends on your rental provider and your specific contract. Some agreements offer flexibility; others may require a penalty or early termination fee.

What happens to my old data?

Reputable rental companies will wipe the data from your old machine before reselling or recycling it. Still, ask for a data removal certificate for peace of mind.

Will my monthly rental fee increase?

If you’re switching to a more advanced copier, expect a slight increase. However, improved efficiency may offset the higher fee in terms of productivity and consumables.

Do I need to retrain my staff?

Most modern copiers are user-friendly, but it’s always a good idea to schedule a short training session with your provider to make the most of new features.

Final Thoughts: Upgrade with Confidence

Upgrading or changing rental copiers is a strategic decision that can enhance productivity, reduce costs, and support your sustainability goals. With technology evolving quickly, staying with outdated machines can limit your business potential.

Take time to assess your needs, understand your rental agreement, and work closely with your provider for a smooth transition. Whether you're scaling up, improving efficiency, or adjusting to hybrid work, an upgrade can move your business forward.
